results.title: Crime over London
results.creator_credit: Criterion Ltd, Marcel Hellman and Alfred Zeisler
results.brief_description: A British drama revolving around a store owner who shelters gangsters trying to evade the law. Cast includes Margot Grahame, Paul Cavanagh, Joseph Cawthorn, Basil Sydney and Rene Ray. Written by Norman Alexander and Harold French, based on the novel ‘House of a Thousand Windows’ by Louis De Wohl. Photographed by Victor Armenise and Claude Friese-Greene. Edited by Conrad von Molo.

results.title: Crime on the streets
results.brief_description: This film recounts the high occurence of street crimes, including theft, burglary, assault and rape. Shows how the behaviour of victim often encourages criminals. Suggests ways of protecting the individuals as well as his/her property from attack. Featuring an interview with Chuck Norris.

results.title: Crime Inc. - Volume 2.
results.brief_description: The second and last volume of this series turns to the efforts of crimefighters such as J. Edgar Hoover to stop organized crime, and shows the extent of the gangsters’ control of gambling in Las Vegas and Atlantic City. Multi-million dollar gambling empires are run by criminals, despite strict supervision and laws. The video consists of two parts: “Racket busters” and “Birthright of gangsters.” Written and narrated by Martin Short.

results.title: Crime Inc. - Volume 1.
results.brief_description: First volume in a two volume series which traces the origins and operations of the Mafia in the U.S.A. Includes footage of interviews with FBI informers and home movie clips providing background to Mafia “families” today - their allegiances, lifestyles and feuds. The video is divided into two parts: “All in the family” and “The Making of the mob”. Written and narrated by Martin Short.

results.title: Crime and punishment
results.brief_description: Directed by Josef Von Sternberg this is the first English language version of Dostoyevsky’s novel of obsession, murder and guilt. Peter Lorre stars as the criminology student turned murderer and Edward Arnold as the detective who breaks him. This is an example of Hollywood tackling the great Russian epic and achieving it with style.

results.title: Cries from within
results.brief_description: Looks at new cults and new forms of self-discovery which young people in North America are embracing. Group dynamics, encounter groups, transcendental meditation, Eastern philosophy, communal living, return to nature, re-energised evangelism - all are roads to salvation according to the individual belief.

results.title: Cries from the deep
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Cousteau Society, Jacques Bobet, Jacques-Yves Cousteau, Jean-Michel Cousteau and Jacques Gagne
results.brief_description: The first of a two-part series, this film records the journey undertaken by marine explorer Jacques-Yves Cousteau, his 24-member team, and a Natianal Film Board of Canada crew. Working from the ‘Calypso’, a converted minesweeper transformed into a sophisticated oceanographic vessel, the team uses a helicopter, a diving saucer, inflatable boats and scuba diving equipment to explore the Grand Banks of Newfoundland, one of the world’s richest fishing areas. They discover shipwrecks, film icebergs, visit wildlife sanctuaries, where man is still an alien presence, and observe such endangered species as the beluga whale, humpback whale and harp seal. There is a fasscinating sequence showing ‘Calypso’ divers freeing a calf whale entrapped in a fishing net.

results.title: Cricket: Australian style
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Don Murray and Neil Howe
results.brief_description: A documentary on cricket as it is played in Australia in 1974. Offers highlights from a match between Australia and New Zealand and presents comments about the game by the then Australian captain Ian Chappell.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Film Australia, Don Murray and Neil Howe

results.title: Cricket story
results.brief_description: Cricket in Australia from the early days to the 1961 Australian tour team, including an interview with Sir Donald Bradman, who discusses the factors behind Australia’s success in cricket. School cricket, expert coaching, Sheffield Shield matches and selection for Test cricket. The last match of the 1961 series with the West Indies at the Melbourne Cricket Ground, and the memories and traditions associated with Test cricket.
